title: Cleaning up crypter initialization
body:

* Changed the way crypter is initialized in segment upload accordingly
* Configs will be prefixed with crypter.class.${CRYPTER_CLASS_NAME}, and each crypter will call init with the subset of configs from the ${CRYPTER_CLASS_NAME}
* Added unit test for custom crypter

title: Stream config refactor
body:
Refactor the stream config so that any stream can be plugged into pinot realtime.
References to kafka specific properties have been moved into a KafkaLowLevelStreamConfig and KafkaHighLevelStreamConfig. 

The StreamConfig will only contain the properties which are applicable to any stream
- _type (eg. kafka) 
- _topicName (topic name)
- _consumerTypes (highlevel or lowlevel)
- _consumerFactoryClassName
- _offsetCriteria
- _decoderClass
- _decoderProperties
- _connectionTimeoutMillis
- _fetchTimeoutMillis
- _flushThresholdRows
- _flushThresholdTimeMillis
- _flushSegmentDesiredSizeBytes

Kafka specific properties have been pulled into 
KafkaLowLevelStreamConfig
- _kafkaTopicName
- _bootstrapHosts

KafkaHighLevelStreamConfig
- _kafkaTopicName
- _groupId
- _zkBrokerUrl
- _kafkaConsumerProperties

Any stream implementation can create their own LowLevel/HighLevel StreamConfig to wrap stream specific properties. These specific properties can be used in the stream specific consumers, just  like KafkaLowLevelStreamConfig is used in KafkaPartitionLevelConsumer.

The properties should be provided as

"streamType": "**myStream**",
"stream.**myStream**.topic.name": "MyTopicName",
"stream.**myStream**.consumer.type": "lowlevel",
"stream.**myStream**.consumer.factory.class.name": "com.linkedin.pinot.core.realtime.stream.impl.myStream.MyStreamConsumerFactory",
"stream.**myStream**.consumer.prop.auto.offset.reset": "largest",
"stream.**myStream**.decoder.class.name": "com.linkedin.pinot.core.realtime.stream.impl.kafka.MyStreamAvroDecoder",
"stream.**myStream**.decoder.prop.prop1": "a decoder property for myStream",
"realtime.segment.flush.threshold.time": "12h",
"realtime.segment.flush.threshold.size": "500000",
_"stream.myStream.additional.property": "xyz",
"another.additional.property": "pqr"_       

The stream will have to implement their own 
1. Stream specific `StreamConfig` wrappers 
2. `StreamConsumerFactory` which will provide the `StreamLevelConsumer`, `PartitionLevelConsumer` and `StreamMetadataProvider`
3. `StreamMessageDecoder` and `MessageBatch` 

The example implementation in the code is for kafka simple stream:
1. `KafkaHighLevelStreamConfig` and `KafkaLowLevelStreamConfig` are the stream specific StreamConfig wrappers
2. `SimpleConsumerFactory` is the stream consumer factory which supplies `KafkaStreamLevelConsumer`, `KafkaPartitionLevelConsumer`, `KafkaStreamMetadataProvider`
3. `KafkaAvroMessageDecoder` and `KafkaJSONMessageDecoder` are the decoders and `SimpleMessageBatch` is the MessageBatch implementation

title: Limit the number of groups stored both inner segment and inter segment
body:
Motivation: when executing aggregation group-by queries, currently all
intermediate results are stored in a map on heap. When encountering
queries with huge scan and hit large number of groups, we might run
into issue of running out of heap memory (one map could end up being
multiple gigabytes). To prevent this, we need to limit the number of
groups stored in memory.
Solution: we set a threshold on number of groups allowed both inner
segment and inter segment (default 100,000). When the number of groups
go beyond this value, no new groups will be created, but we will keep
doing aggregation to the existing groups until all documents get
processed.
Heuristics: this is a best effort way of keeping the result correct
but reduce the memory footprint. The assumption is that, if the group
is not showing up in the first 100,000 groups, then this group is not
important, and probably will not show up in the final result. So it's
safe to just ignore this group.
NUM_GROUPS_LIMIT can be configured case by case, and if it's configured
as Integer.MAX_VALUE, it's the same as current behavior.

- Added configurable NUM_GROUPS_LIMIT
- Limit number of groups in GroupKeyGenerator (inner segment)
- Limit number of groups in CombineGroupByOperator (inter segments)

On-the-fly trim related code is removed for the following reason:
- With the current group-by semantic, no easy way to implement it, and
    it's never enabled
- It should not be implemented in ResultHolder because it's not
    aggregation type independent
- The new feature borrows the 'numGroupsLimit' config from it
- If we want to implement on-the-fly trim in the future, we can start
    a new design from scratch

title: [PINOT-7008] Include the brokerRequest in the log message when group-by operator times out
body:
Currently, when we see group-by timeouts on the server side, its unclear which request the server timed out on. At best we can correlate with broker logs to guess which request might have triggered the issue. This change includes the (deconstrcuted) broker request in the log to provide more clues. The code does not have access to the pql, but a log like this should still provide valuable info:
"Timed out while combining group-by results after 14985ms Broker request: BrokerRequest(querySource:QuerySource(tableName:Test_OFFLINE), aggregationsInfo:[AggregationInfo(aggregationType:count, aggregationParams:{column=*}, isInSelectList:true)], groupBy:GroupBy(topN:10, expressions:[id]))"

title: Update the TimeboundaryInfo in Pinot Broker when offline segments are refreshed.
body:
**Problem** As mentioned in #3089, in Uber several users of Pinot realtime+offline tables set their offline table segments in Override mode. In this mode, offline segments are overwritten in a regular basis using the same segment names. We observed TimeBoundaryInfo(**TBI**) is not updated and advanced to reflect the max(secondsSinceEpoch) in the offline tables. Because the TBI is stale, the data in offline segments will eventually dropped out of the combined query results.  

**Root cause** In the offline segment refresh method refreshSegment(): https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/blob/9ea11693d693d53f5712571cb1259344b5b17cc9/pinot-controller/src/main/java/com/linkedin/pinot/controller/helix/core/PinotHelixResourceManager.java#L1497-L1507

By default (i.e., if the table config does not have custom config banning direct message), the controller only sends messages to servers for segment reload but it does not ask Brokers to refresh the time boundary. The else branch, on the other hand, goes through a Helix state transition to reload the segments in servers and the brokers also get notified in the process to update their TBI. So the two branches have different behaviors. Note that the two modes also imply different refreshing costs: Helix state transition incurs higher cost than direct messaging. 

**Proposed fix**
 Our fix is to let the controller also message the brokers just like what it does for servers. The brokers can then compute the new TBI. To avoid the potential message storm resulted from multiple segment uploads happen in a short period of time. Brokers will update TBI asynchronously: a background thread periodically groups all TBI update requests for the same table together and only compute TBI once for all such requests. 

A new message TimeboundaryRefreshMessage and the associated MessageHandlerFactory are created for message exchanges.

title: Refactor stream config properties related constants
body:
As part of the next steps for the issue: https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/issues/2583, we plan to unify all stream related configs into StreamConfigs and remove StreamProviderConfigs. We will also be introducing stream specific config classes such as KafkaStreamConfig. 
This is the first part of that step, which is moving over configs from CommonConstants into StreamConfigProperties, and separating out kafka stream related configs into KafkaStreamConfigProperties.
The follow up of this would be to clean up StreamConfigs and move all kafka specific fields into a KafkaStreamConfig.

title: Add metadata info and metric when querying non-existing columns
body:
This PR adds metadata info and metric when querying non-existing columns. 
The metric is used to monitor how many tables do we currently query with non-existing columns, so that we can take some follow up actions, like including warning message in the response, etc.
The metadata info will be like ` "pruningReasons": ["DataSchemaSegmentPruner"]`. 
Thus the response output will be like:
```
{
    "selectionResults": {
        "columns": ["l_comments", "l_discount"],
        "results": []
    },
    "exceptions": [],
    "numServersQueried": 1,
    "numServersResponded": 1,
    "numSegmentsQueried": 1,
    "numSegmentsProcessed": 0,
    "numSegmentsMatched": 0,
    "numDocsScanned": 0,
    "numEntriesScannedInFilter": 0,
    "numEntriesScannedPostFilter": 0,
    "numGroupsLimitReached": false,
    "totalDocs": 7280281,
    "timeUsedMs": 8,
    "segmentStatistics": [],
    "traceInfo": {},
    "pruningReasons": ["DataSchemaSegmentPruner"]
}
```

title: Adding backwards compatibility for segment upload
body:
* The new segment upload behavior is not backwards compatible with the old segment upload behavior in that the new one creates its own final location URI and will move the segment to this location while the old one took the header offered as the final location
* To remedy this, I am adding 2 endpoints, an old endpoint /segments and /v2/segments for the new segment upload (with the move) with an upload_version header.
* The old segment upload endpoint will still work if you call the old endpoint. I have also changed the default endpoints generated in our code to call the v2 endpoint.

title: Fix a breaking change that download uri in zk is not the same as upload uri
body:
Hi @jenniferdai,

Our offline pipeline are all based on URI upload type. And we expected downloadUri in SegmentMetadata in Zookeeper is the same as the upload uri we set in the request header.

Currently we have segments serving by two hdfs clusters: unsecure hdfs(Example URI: _hdfs://path/to/unsecure/segment_) and secure hdfs(Example URI:  _viewfs://path/to/secure/segment_).

I put a quick fix here, but maybe you have more thoughts on the "FileUploadPathProvider", please advise.

title: Move StreamMessageDecoder into StreamConsumer
body:
The data manager level doesn't need to manage the decoding of the messages. It can be handled by the stream consumer. The StreamLevelConsumer already has decoder inside the consumer. Adding a method in PartitionLevelConsumer to decode a message. This will allow us to remove decoders from LLRealtimeDataManager. The consumers are responsible for creating the decoder they need using the stream configs and StreamDecoderProvider.
The classes StreamConsumerFactory, StreamLevelConsumer and PartitionLevelConsumer show how the updated interfaces look like.

title: Refactor checks when shutting down pinot server
body:
This PR refactors checks when shutting down pinot server, so that:

- `_checkIntervalTimeMs` will always be positive, which means the thread wouldn't be busy spinning to check the updates.  `_maxShutdownWaitTimeMs ` can be non-positive, so that these two checks are configurable to be ignored.
- Pinot server is guaranteed to shutdown when reaching max waiting time.
- `_maxQueryTime` is also included in the total waiting time.

title: Fix ValidationManager, reduce logs and ZK accesses
body:
1. Fix the bug where we should use push frequency instead of time unit to count missing segments
2. Remove the log for missing segments because we already emit the metrics
3. Reduce ZK accesses by caching the instance configs

Once we detect some segments might be missing, we can list the segments and find the missing segments

title: [TE] rootcause - exclusion filter support
body:
End-to-end integration for exclusion filters in UI and remaining backend. Exclusion support is ubiquitous for time series, aggregates, and heatmap but also contingent on data source and data set support.

* expansible exclusion filter selector
* time series support
* aggregates support
* heat map support
* metric label for exclusion filters
* warning on non-additive metrics
* backend utils and unit tests
* CSV data source exclusion support (pinot already done)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25439965/46772327-5c502e80-ccac-11e8-9473-fdda228011d2.png)

title: Changing SegmentFetcher init to include protocol
body: * Currently, we create the correct pinotFS inside the fetchSegmentToLocal method in SegmentFetcher. Instead, we want the init method to create the correct class and place that inside the segment fetcher map. This PR will add a protocol argument to the init constructor of SegmentFetcher to accomplish this.

title: [ThirdEye][s] Fix StringUtils on empty property value
body: An exception is thrown when encountering empty property value. The pr is to fix the exception when input property has empty property value. For example, we may have a property string, a=a;b=. We expect to have {"a":"a","b":""}. Before the fix, the StringUtils will throw an exception because it gets nothing from b's value.

title: Removing extra copy in default crypter during segment upload
body: * Currently, we have two unnecessary copy calls during segment upload if we are using the default crypter. Essentially, "decrypting" the segment is not needed. Also, we do not need segment fetcher to do an extra copy; in the case of segment, we will simply start with the segment in its final location.

title: Get no-dictionary columns during metrics aggregation for consuming segment, instead of config.
body:
Since metric aggregation happens for consuming segment only, the
restriction of dimensions having dictionary and metrics not hacving
dictionary applies only to consuming segments.

For example, String dimensions always have dictionary for consuming
segments, regardless of config setting. This turns off metrics
aggregation even though the String dimension has dictionary.

The fix relies on the actual dictionaries created for consuming
segments, as opposed to what is specified in the config.

Modified the existing test to cover this case.

title: [Star-Tree V2] Index builder for Star-Tree V2
body:
MultipleTreesBuilder is the top level builder that can build multiple star-trees based on a list of builder configs
BaseSingleTreeBuilder contains the common methods for the single tree builder
OnHeapSingleTreeBuilder extends BaseSingleTreeBuilder and use on-heap memory to build the tree
OffHeapSingleTreeBuilder extends BaseSingleTreeBuilder and use off-heap memory to build the tree
StarTreeIndexCombiner can combine all index files for multiple star-trees into one single data file and an index map file

title: Add abstract class PeriodicTask to unify duplicate code
body:
This RB:

- adds abstract class PeriodicTask to unify some duplicate code.
- adds another class to specify Controller's PeriodicTask, which can only be run by Pinot controller only.
- adds periodic task scheduler, so that all the periodic tasks share the same executor with different task interval times.
- refactors logic so that some cleanup code would be called only once, i.e. leadership transition.
- adds unit tests.
